newsitem.title: CHINA: China finds 10 oilfields in northwest Xinjiang.
newsitem.headline: China finds 10 oilfields in northwest Xinjiang.

text.p: China has discovered 10 new oilfields and oil-bearing areas in its northwestern Xinjiang region in the last year, the overseas edition of the People's Daily said on Thursday.
The Karamay oilfield saw a new field discovered this year in northern Xinjiang's Gurbantunggut desert with a possible output capacity of 1.0 million tonnes of oil, it said.
Prospectors discovered a field with estimated reserves of more than 50 million tonnes of oil in the region's Tuha basin, it said.
In the Tarim basin, prospectors discovered an area rich in oil and gas while developing four other oilfields, it said.
Xinjiang was expected to produce 14.4 million tonnes of crude in 1996, 2.0 million tonnes more than last year, it said.

Despite being hit by severe floods in July this year, the Tarim oilfield produced 8.25 million tonnes of crude oil between January and July, completing 57 percent of its state-set output target for the year, it said.
The new oilfields would help the region to achieve its target for oil production in the 1996-2000 Five Year Plan of 20 million tonnes, it said.
